comment.author: 78372713@N00
comment._content: I'm curious about why you don't correct the quality of the photos you post.

comment.author: 34586311@N05
comment._content:
Hi judylcrook-
Thanks for your question. As archivists we try to avoid over-correcting images, trying to represent the images in their historic states. These lantern slides are several decades old, and often time is not kind to them...
Tiah

comment.author: 78372713@N00
comment._content: I think I'd probably post uncorrected and corrected versions, then. Of course, it makes me happy to correct my personal old slides that I've posted. My grandfather's fireplaces are no longer red. Thanks for the response. My 1966 Oregon photos: www.flickr.com/search/?w=78372713%40N00&q=oregon+lumb...
